website_summaries.verdict: This packable pouch stretches to fit your binoculars like a glove. It's compact for packing inside your backpack or glovebox, but also comes with a waist strap.
pros: Protects from dust, moisture and impacts
Waist strap adjusts up to 60 inches
Case measures between 6.5 inches to 7.5 inches in length and 5 inches to 5.5 inches in width
Not too bulky in your pack
cons: the shape and style of the pouch keep it shut

customer_reviews.title: Be sure BEFORE you buy, Not sold by US company
customer_reviews.text: The case didn't fit. Returns go back to UK. Be prepared to pay International Rate to return. Made in the US but sold by UK company
customer_reviews.author: ms m

customer_reviews.title: Best binocular case for fast action
customer_reviews.text: This case (roof small size) fits my Leitz 10x40 BA binoculars perfectly as if it was designed for it. This case is lightweight while still providing excellent protection, and slips off quickly so I can grab the binoculars fast when something interesting happens. To top it off this case is Made in the USA. No need to look any further -- highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: D. Coral

customer_reviews.title: Useful padded case but should have a positive closure
customer_reviews.text: This pouch would hold items more securely if it had a Velcro or other positive closure. Otherwise, it is fine
customer_reviews.author: DeltaNine

customer_reviews.title: Snug and works well on my 8.5x42
customer_reviews.text: Snug fit on my 8.5x42 Swaros but neat, appear well made and does the job. There's no clasp or similar to secure the flap but I have found that it stays in place anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Magnet

customer_reviews.title: Nice, compact and snug
customer_reviews.text: Needed a smaller/portable carry case for my Bushnell. This served it's purpose. Nice, compact and snug. Still need to be careful as it's a soft pouch.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lin

customer_reviews.title: There is no way to mount this to a bag.
customer_reviews.text: It is just a pouch, probably good for carrying a spare set of binos in your hunting rig but nothing more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Barely Fits Maven B3, but great protection
customer_reviews.text: Very nice material. Good for everyday transport, and keeps the glass clean.
customer_reviews.author: RollerCoffee

customer_reviews.title: Decent cushioning but doesn't close adequately
customer_reviews.text: The concept of neoprene cushioning seems good, but the shallow top flap and lack of any closing mechanism are drawbacks. Like the included nylon belt that shifts weight of the binoculars away from tired shoulders onto hips.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lipmanson

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable pouch
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased a well designed and easy to use pouch fits my medium sized roof prism binoculars just right
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Woolrich

customer_reviews.title: This pouch is well made and fits my binoculars like a glove
customer_reviews.text: This pouch is well made and fits my binoculars like a glove. I own two for my binoculars, and would not leave home without them. Great protection.
customer_reviews.author: Coyotee

customer_reviews.title: Nice pouch
customer_reviews.text: Nice pouch for the binoculars. Would give it 5 stars if there was a closure, Velcro or snap on the front.
customer_reviews.author: JC CityofOAK

customer_reviews.title: Medium roof pouch 12x50 vortex fit tight
customer_reviews.text: Got the medium roof camo pouch for a set of 12x50 vortex diamondbacks. They fit very tightly and is the max sized binoculars you could fit in my opinion. I like the case overall for a neoprene case to protect while using shoulder straps attached to the binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh-Ann

customer_reviews.title: Durable soft pouch
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty straightforward pouch for your binoculars. They were a tight fit on mine, which worked well since I carried them inside a backpack. Durability seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Mochi

customer_reviews.title: Great binocular case
customer_reviews.text: Used for my Leupold Torro binoculars. Perfect fit and provide ample protection for storage and in my pack. Not constructed to wear around your neck or on your waist/belt. If they produced an option for this I would give it a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Craig M. Hutchins

customer_reviews.title: U.S. Made...Perfect for 7x35 Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: This fits my Tasco 7x35 binoculars nicely. The case material is soft and durable. Best feature of all: MADE IN THE U.S.A.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Binoculars easily fit. The binocular strap can be placed on ...
customer_reviews.text: Binoculars easily fit. The binocular strap can be placed on the outside to carry around neck while in pouch. No closure on flap, but flap stays down. There are slits to place on belt but these are not reinforced (have not used).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cover for my binoculars
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well for my very old Jason 12 x 40 binoculars. Easy to get on and off and kept the binoculars protected while in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: James Elder

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect! Just what I was looking for. No bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Seleme

customer_reviews.title: Just enough
customer_reviews.text: Weighs nothing, easy on/off, just enough protection for the bumps while hanging from your neck or to separate gear while stored in a heavier case.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pouch to my 10x42 Nikon Prostaff binoculars since I lost the original case. It fits perfectly and keeps my binoculars safe. Maybe a little overpriced, but it is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I need this, requires neck strap to be on binoculars for use. Might be just the thing for some. Hate to give a star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just a flip-over top - but it works fine!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it to carry my Eagle Optics 8 X 42 Shrike binoculars. I may have been expecting a slightly different way to close/seal this binocular case but it's just open. No velcro, no snap. Thus far it seems to be working fine just something to clarify.
customer_reviews.author: jro

customer_reviews.title: one star too many
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money... took one look at it when it arrived and threw it away. You can buy a better pouch at any big box store and probably cheaper.Useless for it's intended purpose, which is to protect a binocular.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good tight fit on Swarovski 8x32mm bins
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something tight and protective for my expensive 8x32mm binoculars. (The case that came with them is poorly designed. Go figure.) This neoprene case fits tightly and seems quite protective -- I feel a lot better tossing them in my backpack or shoulder bag. It's really just for travel though, this is not a case that I can keep on the bins while using, or get it on and off really quickly. Put it on when they are in my bag, take it off while birding.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: This pouch is perfect as a cover
customer_reviews.text: This pouch is perfect as a cover. It has a hip strap but it is a very narrow width, 1/4" and will not take the full weight of a 8x42mm binos if used on a the supplied hipstrap or a belt. Maybe it is meant to be a bino cover with a neck strap whilst using a harness system??? Anyway good product, but jsut not designed for use on a belt.
customer_reviews.author: alex chin

customer_reviews.title: Clingy and Soft
customer_reviews.text: As with other Op-Tech products, this binocular case is form fitting and very soft to the touch. The nature of the neoprene material gives a cushioning effect for minor bumps, and because it fits the item so well, takes up a lot less space than traditional designs.
customer_reviews.author: H. N. Sodher

product_meta.title: OP/TECH USA Soft Pouch Bino - Roof Medium (Black)
product_meta.description: Pattern:Soft Pouch| Style:Roof, Medium| Color:BlackSoft Pouch - Bino protects binoculars and spotting scopes while in use or in storage. The soft, durable neoprene creates a form-fitted pouch that's ideal for outdoor enthusiasts. The compact design enables binoculars to be packed in small areas such as backpacks and glove compartments. The Soft Pouch - Bino offers a unique storage pouch in addition to a well-designed carrying system. It comes with a waist strap which stabilizes the pouch snugly against your body while offering fast, easy access to equipment. Merely fold back the top flap to quietly release the binoculars. Once combined with an OP/TECH USA weight reduction strap, you have a comfortable and functional system unmatched by any other.
feature_bullets: Soft, durable Neoprene pouch fits Roof binoculars
Protects optics from dust, moisture and impact while in use or in storage
Includes a removable waist strap for easy access and added stability-adjusts up to 60" (152cm)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars53 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
